channel.title: Will Blackmesa run on a mac?
channel.description: So if steam games are going to be ported to mac, do you think mods like blackmesa will run on one as well?

item.title: Will Blackmesa run on a mac?
item.dc:creator: Xilefian
item.description:
Ramirezoid:

welcome to Black Mesa, Macbook edition

Kinda wrong seeing how my father’s Macbook can play TF2 through crossover pretty well…
Plus, you’re in software mode there, Macbook would be opengl if playing native.

As for on topic: The Mac Classic port of Half-Life was never publicly released due to mod incompatibility and the hassle of opening a second branch of tech support, because Source is now coming to Mac you’d assume that they would now cover that issue.

I have to go and sort out the murderous cramp in both my feet.
:’(:’(:’(:’(:’(

Read full topic
item.source: Will Blackmesa run on a mac?

what’s the point of this thread? nobody knows how its going to work except Gabe Newell, so until he decides to let us all in on the secret, this thread is just troll-bait for Aspies that irrationally hate macs.

item.title: Will Blackmesa run on a mac?
item.dc:creator: Jingles
item.description:
garthbartin:

BUUUUULLLLSSSHHHIIITTTTT.
But seriously, all-in-ones pc or mac blow, it’s harder to replace parts

Not everybody knows how to do that

and @bolteh, there is no point rising to people like this, they think they are both always right and that pcs pwn macs. You can’t change someone’s mind in these types of threads, and like you said, it just comes down to personal preference.

item.title: Will Blackmesa run on a mac?
item.dc:creator: Bolteh
item.description:
garthbartin:

It appears most of this has already been bashed, but I think I’ve added a little to your humiliation.

No you didn’t, your blind fanboy brain, again, forgot to take the term “personal preference” into consideration.

And I already know what you’re going to reply, to which I’ll provide you with an answer so I don’t have to read your biased uninformed posts again: it’s not that I have a Mac, that i’m a “macboi” or “macfag” or anything related to those childish terms. I just prefer the system and OS, but I guess your teenage angst is too overwhelming to take that into consideration.
